text: Stonehenge, Avebury and Associated Sites is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Wiltshire, England.UNESCO, "Stonehenge, Avebury and Associated Sites"; retrieved 2012-4-21. Stonehenge and Avebury are groups of large stones called megaliths. Both sites are circles of stones which are placed in a pattern. In each, the placement of the stones and spaces between them may have astronomical meaning. ==History== The creation of Stonehenge and Avebury dates from the Bronze Age. Avebury is to the north of Stonehenge. It is Europe's largest prehistoric stone circle. It has about 100 megaliths. Small sites of prehistoric stones are nearby, including Silbury Hill,EnglishHeritage.org, "Silbury Hill, Avebury"; retrieved 2012-4-21. Windmill Hill,Avebury-web.co.uk, "Windmill Hill"; retrieved 2012-4-21. West Kennet Long Barrow,EnglishHeritage.org, "West Kennet Long Barrow, Avebury"; retrieved 2012-4-21. and Overton Hill.EnglishHeritage.org, "The Sanctuary, Avebury"; StoneCircles.org.uk, "The Sanctuary", Overton Hill; retrieved 2012-4-21. ==Gallery== File:0001-Ground-plan-of-Stonehenge-q75-1139x1590.jpg|Plan of Stonehenge, c. 1840 File:Knight-Stonehenge-Restored- plan-q85-1165x1066.jpg|Stonehenge restored, 1845 File:Knight-Stonehenge- Perspective-elevation-restored.jpg|Stonehenge, perspective view of restored stones, 1845 ==Related pages == * List of World Heritage Sites in the United Kingdom ==References== ==Other websites== * EnglishHeritage.org, Stonehenge * SacredDestinations.com, Stonehenge Category:World Heritage Sites in the United Kingdom Category:Stone circles Category:Archaeological sites in Wiltshire Category:National Trust properties Category:Henges Category:Neolithic Category:Buildings and structures in Wiltshire
title: Stonehenge, Avebury and Associated Sites
